artist: Maker: Worcester Porcelain Works (a.k.a. Royal Worcester Porcelain Company)
creditline: Gift of James F. and Louise H. Bell in memory of James S. and Sallie M. Bell
description: part of a tea service 31.9.6-29; round; blue chrysanthemums in center; Holiday Traditions, Charleston Drawing Room
text: Worcester became one of the top English porcelain firms. This teapot, from a tea service shows how Asian motifs such as the chrysanthemum, in the popular blue and white scheme, dominated English porcelain in the late 18th century.
title: Teapot, from a tea service
